meanings.definition: Treated to have a soft, smooth finish resembling suede.
meanings.sent1: The sueded fabric felt gentle against her skin.
meanings.sent2: She loved the sueded texture of her new jacket.
meanings.sent3: The cat curled up on the sueded blanket, purring contently.
meanings.sent4: The sueded sky at sunset painted the horizon in soft hues.
meanings.sent5: The sueded petals of the flower were a delight to touch.

meanings.definition: Made to have a surface like suede.
meanings.sent1: His sueded shoes were perfect for the formal event.
meanings.sent2: The chair was upholstered in a sueded material for comfort.
meanings.sent3: The sueded gloves kept her hands warm on the chilly day.
meanings.sent4: The sueded walls of the room added a touch of elegance.
meanings.sent5: The sueded finish on the car's interior gave it a luxurious feel.
